Fields.DialogueText: Pola!
You seem chipper, Capitano.
I was hoping I would run into you.
And why is that?
Just to say that I'm really looking forward to the two of us working together.
Is that a fact?
What can I say? You seem like a confident, competent Belle. Not to mention, most of the crew thinks you are pretty adorable. It's good for morale.
... What did you call me?
What?
*ALARM*
A more deserving target approaches. Clearly God has plans for you.
What did I say?
@BATTLE
Pola... y-you...
Sì, Capitano?

Fields.MenuText: You're somewhat terrifying in battle.
I'm a captain of honor, I'll have you know. It makes me uneasy to have a Belle on board who fights as... dirty as you do.
I take back what I said about you being adorable.

Fields.DialogueText: From now on, when you think of me, it's that terror I'd prefer your mind conjure up. Don't let my appearance fool you.
Then you'd best find a different ship, Capitano.
Molto bene. You learn quickly.
Here are your potatoes, Miss Pola.
... Grazie.
You're really a Belle of many words, aren't you, Pola?
I speak when I have something to say. Surely you won't fault me for that.
No, no, of course not.
Look at that pile of potatoes, Pola! Why don't you give some of those to me - no way a girl like you will be able to eat all of that!
I've seen that look before.
You.
M-me?
Yes, you. Give me the rest of the potatoes.
What?
I... I really shouldn't do that.
Give. Them. To. Me. I'll show this officer how much a girl like me can eat.

Fields.MenuText: Go ahead and give her the potatoes.
Pola, you really ought to ask my permission before demanding potatoes from the mess hall.
Oh, I have to see this.

Fields.DialogueText: See? Give. Them. To. Me.
Of course, Capitano. How adorably selfish of me.
Rest assured - I'll show him.
*ALARM*
How do you feel about binging cold mashed potatoes, Pola?
Oh, I hate all potatoes in all forms, cold or hot. But if it gives me a chance to prove this loser wrong, I won't pass it up.
@BATTLE
Pola, why are you wearing Officer Nowak's uniform?
Oh, questi stracci? Just won the lot off him during a poker game. Now I'm rubbing my victory in a little.
If you're wearing his clothes, what's he wearing?
Take a look.
Oh, good grief. That's an eyeful I really could have done without.
Look at him, trying to scurry back to his bunk without anyone noticing. Heh.
Nowak! A little breezy - non è vero?

Fields.MenuText: Has anyone ever told you you're a bit of a bully, Pola?
Looks like I'm going to have to have a conversation with someone regarding proper decorum.
Ha! Look how red his face is.

Fields.DialogueText: Sì. What of it?
You're a bit of a stick in the mud, you know that?
It's quite a contrast from the blinding paleness of the rest of his body.
Just... don't let this gambling get out of hand, all right? Some here and there can be a good way to unwind, but I don't want the crew getting too worked up. Understand?
Certo, Capitano.
Can all Belles roll their eyes so far back their irises disappear or is it just you?
It's a talent I've spent much time perfecting.
*ALARM*
Of course it is. Now, come on. Let's go.
@BATTLE
All crew to action stations. Stay out of my way.
@BATTLE
Pola? What's going on in there? What's all the laughing about?
Just a little... post-battle celebration, Capitano.
I suppose the cigar in your left hand and the bottle of Chianti in your right should have tipped me off...
*hic* Probabilmente.

Fields.MenuText: Don't you think you've had a little too much of that Chianti?
I don't mind a little celebrating, but I caution you not to go overboard, Pola.
Give me that bottle. I want a drink.

Fields.DialogueText: No. *hic* Don't ruin my fun.
I'm the *hic* ship, Capitano! I'm the only person here... who can't go overboard!
No, it's *hic* mine.
Pola! Come back, we're about to start the drinking contest!
Oh, I really don't know that that's a good idea, Pola.
I can *hic* handle my own... affairs, Capitano. If the men on board this ship are *hic* to take me seriously, then I must prove... myself to them.
I'm not sure out-smoking and out-drinking them is the way to go about that...
You have your ways, and I have mine.
Toglietevi di mezzo, boys! I'll show you how it's done!
Get to your stations! Adesso!
@BATTLE
Officer Reza! You'll stop when I'm speaking to you! You were out of line during that battle!
Woah, what's going on?
Miss Pola issued a direct order to Officer Reza during the fight, and he ignored it.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, that's not good.
What was Pola doing issuing orders during battle in the first place?
I have to see this...

Fields.DialogueText: I thought for a moment Pola's head might explode.
She does so all the time - were you not aware of that?
Capitano... shouldn't you maybe... stop it from escalating?
All right, little girl, there's no need to get so hysterical.
Hysterical?
Uh oh.
AUGH!
Did she just punch him in his face?
She did just punch him in his face.
Medics! We have a gusher, over here!
You... little...
And... he passed out. Strong constitution, that one.
Medics, over here, please. Pola?
I'm adding white thread and cotton to my next requisition. This glove has served its purpose.
We need to talk, Pola.
Come to think of it, some vinegar might fix the stain. I'll be in the galley.
Well, you're no fun.
Get to your stations! Now!
@BATTLE
Pola - we still need to talk.
No, we don't. I know what you're going to say.
"Pola, now, you really ought not punch my officers in the face."

Fields.MenuText: Well, yes. It was going to be something along those lines.
Do you know why I'd rather you not punch my officers in the face?
That's what you think I sound like?

Fields.DialogueText: Sono scioccata.
Do you think I care?
Own it, Capitano.
Pola, you are in a position of authority over this crew. If you want them to respect you, then you need to set a good example and look out for their best interests.
You would say that...
Do you see the crew questioning my authority?
You don't think there's the slightest chance that the crew would treat you similarly if you looked like me?
There's only one way to find out.
... You're going to dress up like me?
No, Pola, of course not. You're going to follow my example, looking out for the crew's best interests, and see whether or not that has an effect on them.
They're alive, aren't they?
Just try it.
... Maybe.
Hmph. My back aches from having to carry this ship through every battle, but here we go again.
@BATTLE
Pola? What's going on? What's all the yelling?
A few of the officers are accusing the crew of not having their backs during that last battle.
All right, come on.
Ch- che cosa? What do you mean?

Fields.MenuText: We're going to break up the fight.
These men and women need to know that we're in charge.
I want a better seat to see the action.

Fields.DialogueText: You're kidding.
Oh, I'm sure they'll find the pair of us quite intimidating.
I know you're being sarcastic.
Remember what I asked? Follow my example, looking out...
Sì, sì, sì - you don't need to repeat the whole song and dance. All right, let's go.
Hey, you two! Yes, you two, dangling that crewman overboard by his ankles! You better pull him back up this instant!
You heard her!
If anyone administers corporal punishment around here, it's me! Nessun altro!
It's going to be a long tour.
You little rat!
Call me a rat one more time!
Basta! Break it up, you two! Stand down!
Pola!
Sorry, Pola. We-
What's going on here?
I saw him, I saw him, Captain! Hiding a card up his sleeve!
Oh, you're just a sore loser, you know that? So confident in your own ability that all you can do is accuse your opponent of cheating when you lose!
All right, the gambling on this ship is out of control. For the time being, I'm putting a moratorium on all games.
Che diavolo?!
You can't do that!
You better believe I can. If it's causing arguments, it's a distraction we can't afford. If I catch you playing when you shouldn't, you're going to be in for it. Understand?
Understand?
Yes, Captain.
Yes, Captain...

Fields.MenuText: Don't look so downcast, Pola. I know you like gambling as much as anyone else on this ship, but it's for the good of the crew.

Fields.DialogueText: Is it?
Hmmm?
*ALARM*
Come on, let's go. We've got more important things to worry about.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Anything to add, Pola?

Fields.DialogueText: No. You can make your own mistakes.

Fields.MenuText: Don't pretend you didn't see this coming.

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose I didn't expect you to be  so...decisive.
You've seemed unusually pensive lately, Pola.
Cosa intendi, Capitano? I can be pensive.
I didn't say you couldn't be pensive. I just meant that it's a change from what's normal.
See, like that, there. What's on your mind?
I think you were wrong to ban gambling on the ship.

Fields.MenuText: It was causing fights. Surely you understand my motivation.
You're questioning my judgment?
That sounds like an awfully self-serving complaint, Pola.

Fields.DialogueText: If avoiding future fights was your motivation, I fear you may have done yourself a disservice.
Sì. I am allowed to do that, you know.
But it is not solely self-serving.
Much of the crew use gambling as a means to unwind. It's an outlet for their stress. Without it...
There are other means of unwinding aboard this ship, Pola.
And I never said gambling was banned for good - once the crew proves themselves to be better disciplined, I will rescind the ban.
*ALARM*
If you say so, Capitano.
I do.
@BATTLE
Pola? What happened to your face?
I could ask you the same question - unfortunately, you'd just have to say it's looked that way from birth.

Fields.MenuText: I was trying to be considerate, you know.
I don't like that attitude, Pola.
I... I always thought I was rather good-looking...

Fields.DialogueText: Hopefully this will teach you to avoid such tendencies in the future.
È un peccato. Really. A shame.
Well, that's pitiful.
Seriously, though, Pola - the black eye, the bloody lip? What happened?
There was a bit of a kerfuffle in the mess hall.
Pola, what did I tell you about setting a good exa...
Calmati, Cap. I wasn't a part of the fight. I rushed in to break it up and ended up on the receiving end of a few fists before I succeeded.
You're kidding.
Damn heroic of me, wasn't it? Don't tell anyone. It will ruin my reputation.
Thanks, Pola. That's not the first fistfight that's broken out recently...
It's almost as if... I don't know... the crew is in need of some sort of outlet for their stress...
Hush, you.
*ALARM*
Your eye is starting to swell - think you'll be able to fight?
Oh, Capitano. I'm plenty used to fighting with only one good eye.
Why does that not surprise me?
@BATTLE
All crew to action stations. Stay out of my way.
@BATTLE
Was that battle a bit more than you were ready to handle, Cap? Your hair's a bit of a mess.
The battle wasn't a problem - the brawl that broke out amongst the crew after, however...
Sventurato.
I know what you're thinking. I know you think that, were I to reinstate gambling, these fights would resolve.
But that's not how one goes about instilling discipline.
I know I've painted myself into a bit of a corner, here...
Maybe the answer lies in finding some sort of new outlet for the crew's frustration.

Fields.MenuText: That wouldn't be such a terrible idea.
It would depend on the outlet.
I'd be willing to try just about anything new, at this point.

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe not...
That's true...
Is that a fact... ?
Have anything in mind?
No, non ancora. But I'll give it some thought.
I'd... appreciate that, Pola.
Ovviamente. I'm involved.
Get to your stations! Adesso!
@BATTLE
Pola!
You're sounding even more needlessly chipper than usual, Capitano.
What can I say? Things are going well. We won that battle...
We win battles all the time.
And we haven't had a fist fight for some time now! There have been a few verbal altercations, but even those were more contained than usual. I'm riding high.
Sì, I'm sure you are.

Fields.MenuText: And it's all thanks to you.
The crew is indebted to you, Pola.
All right, out with it - what did you do?

Fields.DialogueText: How so?
I don't know what you're talking about.
You're sounding like a crazy person, Cap.
You say you're going to brainstorm possible outlets for the crew's frustration. Next thing I know, everyone's getting along. You expect me to believe you didn't do something?
I do.
You're serious?
Sono molto seria. It was a phase; the crew had to come to terms with their differences and being on this ship. Now that they have, tempers have cooled.
I had nothing to do with it.
If you... say so.
I do. Now, if you'll excuse me, I'm going to celebrate with the crew. And by that, I mean drink my rudder numb.
Haha! You should have seen the look on his face!
I did, I did! He had no idea what was coming...
Good day, men.
Hello, Captain!
Good day, Captain!
... Wait. You two!
Captain?
What is it, Captain?
Would you like to explain the black eyes the two of you are sporting? And Officer, is your... nose broken?
I think it might be, Captain. We were just on our way to the infirmary.
The two of you were in a fight?
No, Captain!
No, Captain!
You... weren't?
No, Captain. You heard us talking earlier! This here is my buddy.

Fields.MenuText: You're... buddies?
Forgive me if I don't believe you.
Don't use the word "buddy." You're not a nine-year-old.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, Captain!
Well you ought to, Captain! I don't lie about being buddies with a man if it isn't true!
Sorry, Captain?
So what did happen to you two?
In the rush to the mess hall just now, we fell down a flight of stairs.
You expect me to...
*ALARM*
Just don't let it happen again.
Yes, Captain!
Yes, Captain!
@BATTLE
Pola, this box arrived for you with our most recent deliveries. I wasn't aware you ever ordered anything special. Except, you know, more alcohol.
Ah, grazie, Capitano. I'll take that off your hands...
Protective of it, are you? What did you order?
Che maleducato! Don't you know a lady deserves her privacy?
When have you ever been at all concerned with what is or is not ladylike?
The longer you take to answer, the more I worry you've brought contraband aboard this ship.
It's not contraband. It's... makeup.

Fields.MenuText: Well, that's not anything to be ashamed of, Pola.
You... wear makeup?
Well, isn't that just adorable?

Fields.DialogueText: Doesn't mean I want to have the divulge the contents of every item I order.
When I feel like doing so, yes.
I'm still capable of killing you fourteen different ways. And that's just with my bare hands.
All right, all right. My apologies, I shouldn't have pressed.
Captain, we have Morganas headed this w... Pola, is that makeup you're holding?
Get out!
Yes, ma'am!
Saw that coming.
@BATTLE
Cattive ragazze! Send them back to the pit, men!
@BATTLE
Pola?
Dannazione, Capitano, you scared me half to death. I don't remember giving you permission to enter my quarters whenever you please.
Sorry. I wanted to discuss the previous battle with you and decided to wait here for you to arrive.
Bene. Whatever.
Although, first, I was wondering...
Sì?

Fields.MenuText: I don't know anything about makeup, so I'm curious as to why some of your makeup looks... brown.
I know enough about makeup to understand that it should at least match your skin color. So why doesn't this?
This foundation is about twelve shades too dark for someone with your fair complexion.

Fields.DialogueText: It's probably better that you remain uninformed on the subject.
There are complexities regarding makeup that you just couldn't understand.
You speak... awfully knowledgeably on this subject, Capitano. Any reason why?
Pola...
The company just mixed in some of the wrong shades, that's all. Non è un grosso problema.
If you say so.
Now, wasn't there something else you wanted to discuss?
Just strategy for the next battle. But we can discuss it later.
Bene.
Targets, Capitano. Ugly ones.
@BATTLE
Pola, you want to tell me what this is?
Looks like you have dirt on your hand, Capitano. I'm not really sure why I needed to tell you that, though.
This isn't dirt. This is dark makeup.
So you're admitting to going into my room and using my makeup? That's some strange behavior. Molto strano. You feeling all right?
I helped one of the crewmen up after that last battle. Imagine our surprise when my hand came away the same color as his.
Your human physiology never ceases to surprise me.
Not only that, but it looked as if that makeup had been concealing significant bruising on the man's hand.
Uh...

Fields.MenuText: I would appreciate an explanation, Pola.
What are you and my crew up to?
Looks like I'm the one who gets to point out strange behavior now.

Fields.DialogueText: I know. I'm working on it.
What do you think we're up to?
Heh, I suppose this might all seem a little strange...
The crew is in a better place, aren't they? Fewer fights, and all that?
Yes...
Well, a lot of them still had bruising from those earlier fights, and those bruises were reminders of those fights. They were distracting the crew from moving forward.
So I suggested to them, if they wanted, that I could use makeup to cover them up until they healed, to remove the distraction.
And they went for that?
They are... uh... very committed to moving past that unpleasant chapter in their lives.
O... kay.
Pola...
That's not how this conversation is going to work.
What do you see, Pola?
Il nemico si sta avvicinando! Earn your keep!
@BATTLE
Pola! Pola!
Where has she gone off to?
Pola!
Searching for Miss Pola, Captain?
Whatever gave you that idea?
Apologies, Captain.
No, you're right. I should be the one apologizing. Have you seen her?
Can't say that I have, Captain. I'm sure she'll turn up eventually.
Hey - you're on deck duty, aren't you? Where's everyone else?
They're... uh... on their way, Captain. They had to see to some things after that last battle, but I know they'll be back in a jiffy.

Fields.MenuText: All right. Tell them to be more timely in the future.
You seem a little hesitant to answer.
Why do I feel as if I never get a straight answer from people, anymore?

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, Captain!
I'm just not the... uh... best speaker, Captain. Been a mumbler all my life.
Is that one of those... uh... rhetorical questions, Captain? Or do you expect me to answer?
If you see Pola, tell her to come to the bridge - understand?
Yes, Captain!
Back for another beating? Fine, come at me!
@BATTLE
I know I saw Pola come down this hallway...
Captain?
Ah! Officer, I... wasn't expecting you. How goes it?
Everything... goes fine, Captain. Is there anything I can help you with?
Help me with?
Yes, Captain.
Have you... seen Pola?
Pola?

Fields.MenuText: Yes, you know, the supernatural ship spirit who has a penchant for drinking sailors under the table.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, Captain, I know who Pola is. I believe she just headed up to the deck.
I just came from the deck.
Well, you know Pola. Capable of phasing in and out of solid objects and the like.
I suppose that's... true. You're sure she's not still down here?
No, Captain. I mean, yes, Captain, I'm sure.
... Fine. I'll be in my quarters.
Very good, Captain.
All clear.
Took the capitano long enough to leave. Nice work, Officer. There's a bottle of '24 in it for you.
My pleasure, Pola.

Fields.MenuText: Is there an echo in here? I want to see her.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course, Captain. She should be up on the deck at this time.

Fields.MenuText: Start talking or you can cook for her. And you know how picky she is.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, Captain. Unless I'm mistaken, Pola should be up on the deck by now.
Pola!
Capitano! Da do... where did you come from?
Oh, I just had a feeling you might come down this hallway. It seems you've been coming down here a lot, lately.
I don't know what would give you that idea, Capitano.
You know, I have no idea what's on the other side of that locked door there.
D-don't you?
I do not.
Care to let me inside? Since you're the ship's spirit, I assume unlocking locked doors would be under your purview.
I really don't know why you're so interested, Capitano...

Fields.MenuText: Don't make this difficult, Pola. Please, open the door.
I am your captain, Pola. Like it or not, you chose to place yourself under my authority.
I'd rather not use a battering ram, if at all possible. Waste of time and effort, and then I'd have a door to replace. I imagine it wouldn't be comfortable for you, either.

Fields.DialogueText: ... Bene. Here you go.
... Bene. Here you go.
... Bene. Here you go.
*DOOR CREAK*
*YELLING*
Tell me what I'm looking at here, Pola. Because unless I'm hallucinating, it looks as if I'm watching my men pummel one another.
Sì, uh... the men have started referring to it as the... uh... fight club.
*ALARM*
Oh, we'll definitely be discussing this later.
Of that I have no doubt.
@BATTLE
... Now, I'd like to ensure that I've properly instilled these ideas in your minds. So crew! Each of you, repeat after me - I am an adult!
I am an adult...
As an adult, I recognize that there are better uses for my time than pummeling other adults!
As an adult, I recognize that there are better uses for my time than pummeling other adults!

Fields.MenuText: Thank you.
With a little more conviction, please!
Heh, this is kind of fun...

Fields.DialogueText: I recognize that there are better uses for my time than pummeling other adults!
Hrrrrrmmm...
And now, as for your fearless ringleader, Pola...
*ALARM*
After this battle, the two of us will be having a conversation.
Do we have to?
Don't test me right now, Pola.
... Sì, Capitano.
@BATTLE
Sit.
I'd rather stand.

Fields.MenuText: Okay, fine. We have far too many issues to address for me to care, honestly.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm waiting.
Pola, what were you thinking? How terrible is your judgment that you thought the solution to the fights we were having aboard this ship was more fights?
Not a rhetorical question, Pola. Please, I'd like to try to wrap my mind around your thought process here.
Fighting is a well-known outlet for stress. Boxing...
This wasn't boxing.
I know. But it allowed the men to work things out in a controlled environment where neutral parties could step in; where medics were always at the ready.
You have to admit - the ship has been much less dysfunctional than it was before the fight club was started.
That might be true...
But?
But I cannot condone barehanded fights aboard this ship. And...
You deliberately kept this from me - you and the crew. If I'm to be your captain, that sort of insubordination is unacceptable. You had the crew lying for you.
I can tell you were trying - in your own way - to look after the crew. But you and I, we need to be a team. We both need to lead this ship.
*ALARM*
... Sì, Capitano. Come join me in doing that.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: No, you wouldn't.

Fields.DialogueText: No, but I can take it.

Fields.MenuText: I said sit.

Fields.DialogueText: Let's stop this circle before it is drawn.
*YELLING*
Pola? What's happening?
Cosa pensi? Another fight's broken out in the mess.
You're kidding.
Are you surprised?
... Not particularly.
You want to take the left or right side?
You take left, I'll take right?
Molto bene.

Fields.MenuText: Everyone! Everyone, please, calm down!
I will make all your lives a living hell if you don't shut up!
Look everyone, Morganas!

Fields.DialogueText: A little more severity might be helpful, Capitano.
I do appreciate a nice, threatening tone of voice.
Because more chaos is definitely what we need right now.
Quiet!
*ALARM*
Well, they'll either have to stop fighting and work together, or we'll all die.
One way or the other, the problem will take care of itself.
@BATTLE
That's two fires I've put out today.
The fights have become that frequent?
The second actual fire. Which start, somehow, as a result of the fights which have broken out. Ridiculous.
Pola...
Sì, Capitano?
I'm ready to listen to any ideas you have.
I really think tha...
Which don't include bare-handed fighting.
... Boo.

Fields.MenuText: It's just too dangerous, Pola.

Fields.DialogueText: ... There is... something else we could try, then. It would require a little more money to set it up, but...
I'm willing to listen to whatever ideas you have... provided you tell me your ideas before actually enacting them.
*ALARM*
After the battle?
Yes, after the battle.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: I've made myself clear, Pola. You don't have to like it.

Fields.DialogueText: And here I was afraid you'd misread my skulduggery.

Fields.MenuText: I'm this close to confining you to quarters.

Fields.DialogueText: Why shouldn't a good soldier also be a fighter?
Captain? Captain, open up in there, would you?
Ah, Officer. How can I help you?
What are you and Pola up to in there?
Nothing which concerns you at the moment, Officer.
Capitano! Does he have the stuff?
Huh?

Fields.MenuText: Pola would like to know if anything addressed to her has been delivered.
Surely you're capable of something a little more eloquent than "huh."
The stuff! Do you have the stuff?

Fields.DialogueText: Ah, yes! I have something right here, Captain.
Uh... I had trouble hearing Pola, what did she say?
You wouldn't mean this package addressed to Pola, would you?
Bring it here, Capitano! And send that guy on his way - non sbirciare!
*ALARM*
You're going to have to wrap it up for the moment, Pola.
Bene, bene.
@BATTLE
Yes! That's the stuff!
Have any deliveries been made, addressed to her?
Ah, yes! I have one right here, Captain.
Action stations, men! Liberty is a duty, not a right!
@BATTLE
I can't believe you forced the crew to keep their eyes closed while they came down here. Are you that set on this being a surprise?
No, I just wanted to watch them bounce off of one another as they walked. They were like a bunch of ping-pong balls. Heh.
Of course.
Va bene, ragazzi e ragazze! You can open your eyes now.
Are those... ?
Boxing rings!
Yes, they are boxing rings. Pola convinced me that boxing would be a welcome - and I hope somewhat more safe - addition to our ship.
You'll find gloves and other protective equipment at the side of the room.
*APPLAUSE*
They seem to approve.
Of course they do. I have great ideas.
Pola...
Ei, you! I call first fight!
Wait. Seriously, before you go brawl...

Fields.MenuText: Thanks for working together with me on this.
You're awfully impressive, you know that?

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah, yeah... you're welcome, I guess.
Well, there's no reason to get all mushy, Cap.
